name: Tab-Box
description: A single content area with multiple panels, each associated with a header in a list.

problem.title: Screen Real Estate
problem.description: The user needs to navigate through one or more stacked panes of content without refreshing the page in a limited screen real estate.

solution.title: Single Row
solution.description:
Present a single-line row of links immediately above the stacked panes of content they will control.

Never stack multiple rows of tabs to control a single piece of content.

Separate the links with the vertical bar character "|" or through an equivalent graphic.

solution.title: Show Selected
solution.description:
Always show one tab as selected with its content visible;

Indicate the selected tab by highlighting the background of the "cell" around it. Yahoo! adds a "pointer" to the bottom of the selected tab.

solution.title: Content Display
solution.description:
The content should be visually connected to the tab it is associated with and be visually bounded (usually by a box.)
Only one content area may be visible at a time.

usage.title: Context
usage.description: Tabs provide context. They give visual indication of a user's location within a body of information.

usage.title: Similar pattern
usage.description: Tabs build on a real world metaphor. The selected state is reinforced with the file folder tab metaphor of a folder physically in front of the others in the set.

usage.title: Navigation
usage.description: Tabs provide navigation. They provide the ability to navigate alternate content views.

accessibility.title: Navigation
accessibility.description: Allow the user to navigate across the tabs in a logical order with the Tab key.

accessibility.title: Keystroke action
accessibility.description: A focused tab can be selected with the Enter key.

accessibility.title: Make this component accessible
accessibility.description: Question for Rob: How can we insert Markdown in JSON?

accessibility.title: Accessibility Recommendations
accessibility.description:
Indicate the active tab (pane) by one of these alternative means (in addition to visual indication):

Include a TITLE attribute with the word "active" into the link that was just activated.

Include an invisible graphic with an ALT attribute and a word "active" into the link.
Attach an ALT attribute with the word "active" to element that indicates active link.

references.title: Bootstrap
references.description: Add quick, dynamic tab functionality to transition through panes of local content, even via dropdown menus.

references.title: jQuery
references.description:
jQuery's tab widget provides a great collection of examples:

Collapse content
Content via Ajax
Open on mouseover
Simple manipulation
Sortable
Tabs at bottom
Vertical Tabs functionality
